snippet: In Brownsville, Brooklyn, whose housing projects draw thousands of police stops, young men said a court decision would not change police behavior.
abstract: Housing projects in Brownsville, Brooklyn, draw thousands of police stops, and residents there say they did not need a federal court ruling to tell them that New York Police Dept tactics that amount to racial profiling; many support the need for a strong police presence in their neighborhood, one of the city's most dangerous, but say deterrence could come in the form of large, frequent police patrols rather than stop-and-frisk policy.
lead_paragraph: In Brownsville, Brooklyn, whose housing projects draw thousands of police stops, young men said a court decision would not change police behavior.

headline.main: Where Stop-and-Frisk Tactic Is Business as Usual, Skepticism Prevails
headline.print_headline: Where a Police Tactic Is Business as Usual, Skepticism Prevails
